availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, broker. Pendleton County, Kentucky, native. Married Eliza W. Davis in Grant County on September 12, 1839. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in 1850. Broker in Grant County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

bibl.p:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules,
Kentucky, Grant County, p. 357. _Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 111. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 182. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 9. "Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:F4Q1-ZZW : accessed 18 May 2017), Thomas L. Clark and Eliza M. Davis, 12 Sep 1839; citing , Grant, Kentucky, United States, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond; FHL microfilm 1,490,815.
